title: Part a. [0–1]
stimulusHtml:
1 point: For a correct expression of Newton’s law of gravity containing the mass of Saturn, with or without the minus sign
F= G M S m R 2 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOraiabg2 da9maalaaabaGaam4raiaad2eadaWgaaWcbaGaam4uaaqabaGccaWG TbaabaGaamOuamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaaaaGccaGGSaaaaa@3DEF@ where m is the mass of a moon

title: Part b. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

Circular orbit means the force is centripetal.

1 point: For equating Newton’s law of gravity to the centripetal force
G M S m R 2 = m v 2 R OR, F g = F c MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca WGhbGaamytamaaBaaaleaacaWGtbaabeaakiaad2gaaeaacaWGsbWa aWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaaaaaaakiabg2da9maalaaabaGaamyBaiaadA hadaahaaWcbeqaaiaaikdaaaaakeaacaWGsbaaaiaad+eacaWGsbGa aiilaiaadAeadaWgaaWcbaGaam4zaaqabaGccqGH9aqpcaWGgbWaaS baaSqaaiaadogaaeqaaaaa@4768@

1 point: For correctly relating the orbital speed and the period

v=2πR/T  OR  v=ωr and ω=2π/T
G M S m R 2 = m R 2πR T 2
1 point: For a correct relationship between T and R
G M S T 2 =4 π 2 R 3 OR T= 4 π 2 G M S R 3/2

title: Part c. [0–1]
stimulusHtml:
1 point: For any correct pair of quantities that would yield a straight line when graphed

For example, T2 versus R3 OR T versus R3/2
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point

1 point: For any correct pair of quantities that would yield a straight line when graphed

For example, T2 versus R3 OR T versus R3/2

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point

1 point: For any correct pair of quantities that would yield a straight line when graphed

For example, T2 versus R3 OR T versus R3/2

title: Part d. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For appropriate and correct table headings, i.e., powers of T and R consistent with answer to part b.

1 point: For correct units in both columns

1 point: For correct numerical values in at least 75 percent of the table entries, provided that the table will yield a linear graph

Full credit was awarded for completing only one column containing R3/2

title: Part e. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points

1 point: For axis labels consistent with the table and having correct units
1 point: For appropriate numbering of axes

1 point: For correctly plotting data from table (only awarded if numbering is correct)

1 point: For drawing a best-fit linear graph (only awarded if data define a linear graph)

title: Part f. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For correctly indicating a calculation of the slope of the graph (only awarded if graph is drawn)

From the graph shown here
slope= ( 5.6× 10 10 −1.4× 10 10 ) m 3 ( 5.4× 10 25 −1.4× 10 25 ) s 2 = 4.0× 10 10 m 3 4.2× 10 25 s 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@75CE@

1 point: For relating the slope to the equation obtained in part b.

In the example shown here, T 2 = 4π G M S R 3 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamivamaaCa aaleqabaGaaGOmaaaakiabg2da9maalaaabaGaaGinaiabec8aWbqa aiaadEeacaWGnbWaaSbaaSqaaiaadofaaeqaaaaakiaadkfadaahaa WcbeqaaiaaiodaaaGccaGGUaaaaa@407C@
slope of line= 4 π 2 G M S
M S = 4 π 2 G( slope )

M S = 4 π 2 6.67× 10 −11 m 3 /kg•s   4.0× 10 25 s 2 4.2× 10 10 m 3
1 point: For the correct numerical answer
MS = 5.64 x 1026 kg

Solutions for which the slope yields Saturn’s mass directly (e.g., table columns of 4π2R3 versus GT 2 ) received full credit.
